page.title: 01CHESHIRE_STAFFS BORDER AREA.
page.content: Our survey square straddles the Cheshire-Staffordshire border covering areas on the S.E.fringes of the Cheshire Plain and the Pennine foothills. The area is largely agricultural, mainly dairy farms, whose milk production goes towards the famous Cheshire cheese but with pockets of industry. For example computer manufacture, sanitary ware production and a sand quarry. The main settlements are Alsager and Butt Lane with the village of Church Lawton and the fringes of Rode Heath and Scholar Green. Alsager serves largely as a dormitory town and has expanded rapidly since the mid-century. Butt Lane, on the northern edge of the Stoke-on-Trent connurbation, was once a largely coal-mining area but now has a more mixed industrial estate.
